thread.title: There's free chicken for all in this Manchester restaurant TODAY
thread.title_full: There's free chicken for all in this Manchester restaurant TODAY

author: Lucy Lovell
title: There's free chicken for all in this Manchester restaurant TODAY
text:
There's free chicken for all in this Manchester restaurant TODAY It’s free chicken, no wings attached... Share Get What's On updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
February can be a dismal month, but one Manchester restaurant has found a way to brighten up people's lives, or at least their lunchtimes. 
It's first come first served at Yard & Coop 'Big Chook Off', which will see one thousand pieces of chicken up for grabs to diners that visit the Edge Street restaurant TODAY (Wednesday, February 8). 
The joint will be dishing up free portions of the buttermilk fried bird from 12pm to 12am, or until they run out. 
The annual giveaway was previously just for students, but this year's event will be open to every fried-chicken-fan who turns up on the day. 
Carl Morris, co-owner of Yard & Coop, said: “the first two months of the new year always feel pretty bleak, so we thought what better way to cheer up all those Manchester folks with the chance to tuck into a delicious and succulent bird, all for free. Yard and Coop San Carlo to open new Manchester city centre pizza restaurant 
“Our previous Big Student Chook Offs have been such a huge success. This time, we didn’t want the rest of Manchester feeling left behind, so we’re looking forward to sharing the love with everyone across the city and introducing our epic buttermilk fried chicken to some new faces." 
To be eligible to receive a free piece of buttermilk chicken and a portion of chips at the 'Big Chook Off', customers need to sign up to the Yard & Coop database, this can be done at www.yardandcoop.com/chookoff or in the restaurant on the day. Read More
